metadata.title: CVE-2018-20459 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In radare2 through 3.1.3, the armass_assemble function inlibr/asm/arch/arm/armass.c allows attackers to cause a denial-of-service(application crash by out-of-bounds read) by crafting an arm assembly inputbecause a loop uses an incorrect index in armass.c and certain lengthvalidation is missing in armass64.c, a related issue to CVE-2018-20457.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-3.2 - 3.2.1+dfsg-5build1
libradare2-common - 3.2.1+dfsg-5build1
radare2 - 3.2.1+dfsg-5build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.1+dfsg-5build1').
